title: Basic Safety and Infection Control
body:
Infection Control Principles

Follow standard precautions to prevent laboratory-acquired infections: hand hygiene, PPE, safe disposal of sharps, and surface decontamination.

title: Biosafety Levels (BSL 1-4)
body:
Biosafety Levels Overview

Laboratories are classified from BSL-1 to BSL-4 based on risk of pathogens handled. Key features include containment equipment, lab design, and PPE requirements.

  • BSL-1: basic, non-pathogenic
  • BSL-2: moderate risk, pathogens like Hepatitis B
  • BSL-3: high risk, airborne pathogens
  • BSL-4: dangerous/exotic, Ebola, Marburg

title: Laboratory Safety Equipment
body:
Essential Safety Equipment

Includes biosafety cabinets, autoclaves, fire extinguishers, and emergency showers. Correct use minimizes risk of contamination and accidents.
